body:
## Steps to Reproduce

<!-- Please tell us exactly how to reproduce the problem you are running into. -->
Press Ctrl+S shortcut key 

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/76673990/131140922-3c9f446b-4ac3-421f-aa5c-f64f46123bcc.png)

I have to go to the following three constant .dart files, and then press the Ctrl+S shortcut key to successfully hot reload. 

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/76673990/131141312-76ef7cb4-b6f6-4e84-b2f7-a9839020904b.png)

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/76673990/131141626-d25ae676-acaa-45d6-beb7-a165f5c8fa60.png)

Tried restarting the IDE.

---

comment_data.body:
Found the reason is caused by such a piece of code, he did not report an error, but it affected the normal work of flutter hot reload.

`expression ? [...] : [...]` 

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/76673990/131202870-e401b043-9def-45bc-ab79-e77eff680683.png)
The problem needs to be fixed.

Hi @xiao-cao-x 
Thanks for filing the issue, I can reproduce with `ternary operator`, while hot reload works fine without it.

### Only reproduces in Android Studio

### Without ternary operator

https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/48603081/131312063-b8b582d0-a477-4257-a0c5-37bf46fbbf5f.mov


### With ternary operator

https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/48603081/131312089-b9d30d23-e87b-421a-ba23-63a706111782.mov


### No issue in VS Code

https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/48603081/131312132-fec50e67-178f-4d2d-b809-672f4b92cb30.mov





### Reproducible code sample

<details> 
<summary>complete minimal runnable code sample</summary>

```dart
import 'package:flutter/material.dart';

void main() => runApp(MyApp());

class MyApp extends StatelessWidget {
  @override
  Widget build(BuildContext context) {
    return MaterialApp(
      title: 'Material App',
      theme: ThemeData.dark(),
      home: Home(),
    );
  }
}

class Home extends StatefulWidget {
  @override
  State<Home> createState() => _HomeState();
}

class _HomeState extends State<Home> {
  bool fullName = true;

  @override
  Widget build(BuildContext context) {
    return Scaffold(
      appBar: AppBar(
        title: Text('Material App Bar'),
      ),
      body: Center(
        child: RichText(
            text: TextSpan(
                children: fullName
                ? [
                TextSpan(text: 'John\n'),
                TextSpan(text: 'Wick'),
                ]
                : [
                TextSpan(text: 'John'),
            ]
        ),
      ),
    ),
    floatingActionButton: FloatingActionButton(
    child: Icon(Icons.add),
    onPressed: () => setState(() => fullName = !fullName),
    ),
    );
  }
}
``` 

</details>

### Logs

|  `stable`  | `master` |
| :---: |:---: |
|  ‚ùóÔ∏è  |   ‚ùóÔ∏è  | 

Check `flutter doctor -v` outputs for each channel below

<details> 
<summary>flutter doctor -v</summary> 
	
```console

    ‚Ä¢ Java version OpenJDK Runtime Environment (build 11.0.8+10-b944.6916264)

[‚úì] Xcode - develop for iOS and macOS

```

```console
    ‚Ä¢ sdk gphone64 x86 64 (mobile) ‚Ä¢ emulator-5554 ‚Ä¢ android-x64    ‚Ä¢ Android 12 (API 31) (emulator)
    ‚Ä¢ macOS (desktop)              ‚Ä¢ macos         ‚Ä¢ darwin-x64     ‚Ä¢ macOS 12.0 21A5304g darwin-x64
    ‚Ä¢ Chrome (web)                 ‚Ä¢ chrome        ‚Ä¢ web-javascript ‚Ä¢ Google Chrome 92.0.4515.159

‚Ä¢ No issues found!
```
		
</details>

‚úÖ: No Issue ‚ùóÔ∏è: Issue reproduced

Thanks for filing the issue

@stevemessick seems like something is going wrong with the check for whether there are analysis errors. 
@xiao-cao-x can you attach the sample app that reproduces the issue. I'd like to make sure it isn't some setting like "treat analysis warnings as errors" that is causing the problem.

Hi @jacob314
I have provided a code sample in https://github.com/flutter/flutter-intellij/issues/5740#issuecomment-908159976

This is a problem in the internal parser from the Dart plugin. The issue will be tracked as https://youtrack.jetbrains.com/issue/WEB-52545.

Workaround is to surround list literals with parentheses. For example:
```
              text: TextSpan(
                children: fullName
                    ? ([
                  TextSpan(text: "foo"),
                  TextSpan(text: "bar"),
                ])
                    : ([
                  TextSpan(text: "foo"),
                ]),
              ),
```
Thanks, @alexander-doroshko ! Closing this; follow the youtrack issue for updates.
The Dart plugin build with the fix has been published, please update.

rename.from: Hot reload does not work properly.
rename.to: [tools][Android Studio] Hot reload doesn't work with ternary operator in the code

title: [tools][Android Studio] Hot reload doesn't work with ternary operator in the code
